snippet: The authorities will be required to verify the status of people who they suspect are in the country illegally.
abstract: Federal Judge Susan Bolton paves the way for the most controversial section of Arizona’s sweeping immigration legislation, provision requiring authorities to verify the status of people who they suspect are in the country illegally, by denying a request by a coalition of civil rights groups to bar the provision.
lead_paragraph: The authorities will be required to verify the status of people who they suspect are in the country illegally.

headline.seo: Key Element of Arizona Immigration Law Survives Ruling
